Name: 1080 Line
Details: 1400 Ripple shown here. 1400 ripples are short duration lines at a frequency of 1400 Hz and are usually isolated

Name: 1080 Line
Details: Violin Mode Harmonic shown here. Violin modes are short glitches at 500 Hz and harmonics (multiples of 500 Hz - i.e. 1000 Hz, 1500 Hz)

Name: 1080 Line
Details: Wandering Line shown here. Wandering line glitchess meander slowly in frequency

Name: 1400 Ripple
Details: 1080 Line shown here. 1080 lines look like a string of short yellow dots, sometimes connected to form a line, with a frequency around 1080 Hz

Name: 1400 Ripple
Details: Violin Mode Harmonic shown here. Violin modes are short glitches at 500 Hz and harmonics (multiples of 500 Hz - i.e. 1000 Hz, 1500 Hz)

Name: Air Compressor (50 Hz)
Details: Power Line shown here. Power Line are narrow in frequency around 60 Hz and its harmonics (multiples of 60 Hz - i.e. 120 Hz, 180 Hz…) and last 0.2-0.5 seconds

Name: Air Compressor (50 Hz)
Details: Koi Fish shown here. Koi Fish are similar to blip glitches, but resemble a fish with a head, fins, and thin tail

Name: Blip
Details: Repeating Blips shown here. Repeating Blips are blips that are observed to repeat, often 0.25 or 0.5 seconds after one another

Name: Blip
Details: Tomte shown here. Tomtes are lower-frequency blip-like glitches that are usually triangular, and look like the hat that would be worn by a garden gnome

Name: Blip
Details: Light modulation are caused by a malfunction of the 45 MHz modulation signal at Hanford, it often looks like several bright spikes in close succession with low frequency noise at the same time

Name: Chirp
Details: Blip shown here. Blips are short glitches with usually a symmetric 'teardrop' shape

Name: Chirp
Details: Whistle shown here. Whistles (a.k.a. Radio Frequency Beat Notes) have a characteristic 'W' or 'V' shape

Name: Chirp
Details: Paired Doves shown here. Paired Doves are repeating, chirp-like features that alternate in sweeping up and down in frequency

Name: Koi Fish
Details: Blip shown here. Blips are short glitches with usually a symmetric 'teardrop' shape

Name: Koi Fish
Details: Tomte shown here. Tomtes are lower-frequency blip-like glitches that are usually triangular, and look like the hat that would be worn by a garden gnome

Name: Koi Fish
Details: Extremely Loud shown here. Extremely Loud are caused by a major disturbance in the detectors, and cover most of the image

Name: Light Modulation
Details: Blip shown here. Blips are short glitches with usually a symmetric 'teardrop' shape

Name: Light Modulation
Details: Low Frequency Burst shown here. Low Frequency Bursts are short bursts of low frequency noise, usually lower than about 50 Hz

Name: Low Frequency Burst
Details: Light Modulation shown here. Light modulation are caused by a malfunction of the 45 MHz modulation signal at Hanford, it often looks like several bright spikes in close succession with low frequency noise at the same time

Name: Low Frequency Burst
Details: Low Frequency Line shown here. Low Frequency Lines occur at very low frequencies, and do not vary in frequency over long durations

Name: Low Frequency Burst
Details: Scattered Light shown here. Scattered Light are low-frequency, long duration, humpy glitches that usually have several lines stacked on top of each other

Name: Low Frequency Line
Details: Low Frequency Burst shown here. Low Frequency Bursts are short bursts of low frequency noise, usually lower than about 50 Hz

Name: Low Frequency Line
Details: Scattered Light shown here. Scattered Light are low-frequency, long duration, humpy glitches that usually have several lines stacked on top of each other

Name: Paired Doves
Details: Chirp shown here. Chirps are the characteristic shape created by gravitational waves from inspiraling compact objects, sweeping upwards in frequency over time
